title: Model-Free Difference-in-Differences Estimation
text: following simplified example effect states increasing minimum wages county-level teen employment rates comes . subset data available package can loaded dataset contains 500 observations lemp log county-level teen employment. outcome variable first.treat estimate group-time average treatment effects, use didnpreg function didnpreg returns class didnp object. object contains estimates average treatment effects standard errors. see , can call summary function provides estimates often also convenient plot group-time average treatment effects. can done using didnpplot command: red dots plot Event Studies Although
code: library(didnp)   data(qqqqqqqq) tym1 <- didnpreg(   form1,   data = dat2,   subset = mysmpl,   bwmethod = "opt",   boot.num = 399,   TTb = TRUE,   print.level = 2,   cores = 32) summary(tym1) didnpplot(tym1, ylim = c(-.25,.1))

title: Treatment Effect Estimators — didnpreg
code: didnpreg(...)  # S3 method for formula didnpreg(   formula,   data = stop("argument 'data' is missing"),   subset,   bwmethod = "opt",   boot.num = 399,   TTx = FALSE,   TTb = TRUE,   print.level = 1,   cores = 4,   seed = 17345168,   ... )  # S3 method for default didnpreg(   outcome,   regressors,   id,   time,   treatment,   treatment_period,   weights = NULL,   bwmethod = "opt",   boot.num = 399,   TTx = FALSE,   TTb = TRUE,   print.level = 1,   cores = 4,   seed = 17345168,   ... )

title: Treatment Effect Estimators — didnpreg
text: formula object class formula (one can coerced class): symbolic description model. details model specification given `Details' data, # name data frame; must specified 'formula' method used subset NULL, optional subsample 'data' bwmethod "opt", # plug-rule thumb continuous basic categorical, can cross-validation boot.num 399, TTx FALSE TTb FALSE print.level level printing; larger number implies output printed. Default 1. 0 suppresses printing. cores Integer specifies number cores used parallel computation. outcome vector, matrix, data frame length \(NT\). outcome can continuous dummy. regressors data frame \(NT\) rows contains regressors. data frame required identify type/class regressor. id vector, matrix, data frame length \(NT\) identifies unit observation. time vector, matrix, data frame length \(NT\) specifies period id observed. treatment vector, matrix, data frame length \(NT\) zeros control ones treated observations. treatment_period vector, matrix, data frame length \(NT\) zeros period treatment ones period treatment . weights NULL,
